elements.title: Satank Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Satank Bridge (pictured) to Satank, Colorado, was constructed in 1900 for $2,325, while its 2011 restoration was estimated to cost at least $750,000?

elements.title: Caroline Hodgson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one newspaper labelled Caroline Hodgson the "wickedest woman in Melbourne"?

elements.title: Gävle Hospital (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gävle Hospital in Sweden was so overrun with scarlet fever in 1934 that it considered requisitioning a local gymnasium?

elements.title: Gatot Wilotikto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gatot Wilotikto needed approval from the North Korean parliament to marry a local woman?

elements.title: Labor Inducer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 30 women claimed to have gone into labor within 24 hours of eating a Labor Inducer?

elements.title: Friedrich von Pernstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Friedrich von Pernstein, the archbishop of Riga for 37 years, only spent less than five years there?

elements.title: Natick station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the former Natick station building became the basement of a liquor store?

elements.title: a former Indonesian ambassador (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a former Indonesian ambassador was spared by Khmer Rouge forces after repeatedly shouting "Indonesia"?

elements.title: Heracross (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Pokémon Heracross may have contributed to an increase in demand for rhinoceros beetles in both legal and illegal Japanese insect markets?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
